author: poojaranjan
content:
**EIPIP Meeting 55 **
Date and Time: Wednesday, May 04, 2022, at 14:00 UTC
Agenda: https://github.com/ethereum-cat-herders/EIPIP/issues/130

author: poojaranjan
content: <@!683653554631868440> We are hoping to discuss "Core EIPs in an Executable Spec World" in today's EIPIP meeting. If you have any suggestions or concerns to the proposed proposal, please feel free to join or share with us.

author: poojaranjan
content: <@!689161464829050960> is there a chance, you can maybe join the EIPIP meeting

author: sky.cactus
content: <@689161464829050960> Is it possible to make it so the "Changes" don't include files who only changed by way of their filename changing due to moving to a new path?

author: sky.cactus
content: I think that would help a *lot*.

author: timbeiko
content: <@572164844313247764> going to move the EIP translation discussion here to not crowd <#745077610685661265>

author: timbeiko
content: Would you want to translate _all_ EIPs, or only the ones which are currently live on mainnet?

author: galaxybloom.
content: What would be most useful? Maybe start from current and work backward? Part of the benefit for me would be familiarizing myself with the EIPs, so working from front to back or back to front (so to speak) would be fine. I wouldn‚Äôt want to translate dead proposals and probably only proposals that have reached a certain interest threshold, going forward?

author: timbeiko
content: Right, so I think there are two parts to something like this

author: timbeiko
content:
1. Actually translate content
2. Set up proper internationalization infra

author: timbeiko
content: What I'd recommend for (1) is basically forking the EIP repo, and starting to translate EIPs which are Final.

author: timbeiko
content: Then, finding a mechanism for how we merge that back into the EIP repo in a coherent way is a whole other task. We'd probably want to have a good amount of translated content before we start thinking about that. Also, there are a lot of discussions about how to update/change the EIP process (see today in <#745077610685661265>, along with talks of splitting ERCs out of EIPs), so you'd probably want to wait until that has stabilized before finding how to best support translations
